urls.title: Work underway to repair damaged flood defence in Lowdham
urls.description: A major project is underway by the Environment Agency to repair a flood wall in Lowdham, Nottinghamshire, to protect homes and businesses from the devastating impacts of flooding.

text: Watch how we are repairing a #flood wall in Lowdham #Nottinghamshire to protect homes & businesses. Item 2mins 30s into this bulletin from @bbcemt https://t.co/jDOKdMkv31 Full project details https://t.co/GtH24uByLg https://t.co/PjVJeewTcO

urls.title: logo-3
urls.description: Several Jacobs researchers recently completed a report on coastal squeeze for the U.K. Environment Agency which will inform the future management of coastal habitats across all four U.K. nations. The more precise definitions and assessment methods developed in this project have the potential to save £10 -£25 million (~$14-34 million USD)- in the delivery of compensatory habitat delivery over the next 40 years.

text:
Sea-level rise can cause human-made constructions to squeeze coastal habitats, resulting in the loss of life-sustaining environments. 

Learn more in a #podcast about coastal squeeze ft. insights from @EnvAgency & @JacobsConnects: 
 https://t.co/jMLRzEbTDp https://t.co/JMAxSU63PL
